labels.analysis: The VirusTotal MCP Server provides a suite of tools designed for cybersecurity analysis, threat intelligence, and relationship mapping. It allows users to query the VirusTotal API to retrieve comprehensive reports on files, URLs, domains, and IP addresses. The tools provide detailed security scan results, reputation data, behavior summaries, and relationship mappings between malware, threat actors, and network connections. This server enhances threat intelligence capabilities by offering advanced search functionalities and detailed relationship analysis.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is "Security & Authentication" because the server's core functionality revolves around cybersecurity analysis and threat intelligence, which aligns with security tools. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is included because it provides detailed relationship mapping and advanced search capabilities, which are analytical in nature. The secondary label "API Integration" is also relevant due to its reliance on the VirusTotal API for data retrieval.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: VirusTotal MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @emeryray2002/virustotal-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Query the VirusTotal API to obtain comprehensive security analysis reports. Analyze URLs, files, IPs, and domains with automatic relationship data fetching for a complete security overview. Enhance your threat intelligence capabilities with advanced search and detailed relationship analysis tools.

tools.name: get_file_report
tools.description: Deploy Server VirusTotal MCP Server @emeryray2002/virustotal-mcp Try in Playground get_file_report

tools.name: get_url_report
tools.description: Name: get_url_report Description: Get a comprehensive URL analysis report including security scan results and key relationships like communicating files, contacted domains/IPs, downloaded files, redirects, and related threat actors. This tool automatically fetches summary information for these key relationships. For detailed, paginated relationship data, use the 'get_url_relationship' tool.

tools.name: get_domain_report
tools.description: Name: get_domain_report Description: Get a comprehensive domain analysis report including DNS records, WHOIS data, and key relationships like historical SSL certificates, subdomains, resolutions, and related threat actors. This tool automatically fetches summary information for these key relationships. For detailed, paginated relationship data, use the 'get_domain_relationship' tool.

tools.name: get_ip_report
tools.description: Name: get_ip_report Description: Get a comprehensive IP address analysis report including geolocation, reputation data, and key relationships like communicating/downloaded files, historical certificates/WHOIS, resolutions, and related URLs/threat actors. This tool automatically fetches summary information for these key relationships. For detailed, paginated relationship data, use the 'get_ip_relationship' tool.

tools.name: get_file_behavior_summary
tools.description: Name: get_file_behavior_summary Description: Retrieves a summary of all behavior reports (sandbox execution details) for a specific file hash (MD5/SHA-1/SHA-256). This provides a consolidated view of dynamic analysis results from multiple sandboxes.

tools.name: advanced_corpus_search
tools.description: Name: advanced_corpus_search Description: Performs an advanced search across the VirusTotal dataset using VT Intelligence query syntax. This requires a premium VirusTotal API key with Intelligence access. Supports pagination.

tools.name: get_file_relationship
tools.description: Name: get_file_relationship Description: Query a specific relationship type for a file hash (MD5/SHA-1/SHA-256) with pagination support. Use this for in-depth exploration of connections.

tools.name: get_url_relationship
tools.description: Name: get_url_report Description: Get a comprehensive URL analysis report including security scan results and key relationships like communicating files, contacted domains/IPs, downloaded files, redirects, and related threat actors. This tool automatically fetches summary information for these key relationships. For detailed, paginated relationship data, use the 'get_url_relationship' tool. Parameters: url (required): The URL to analyze (e.g., 'http://example.com/badsite', 'https://google.com'). The tool will automatically generate the required VirusTotal URL identifier.

tools.name: get_domain_relationship
tools.description: Name: get_domain_report Description: Get a comprehensive domain analysis report including DNS records, WHOIS data, and key relationships like historical SSL certificates, subdomains, resolutions, and related threat actors. This tool automatically fetches summary information for these key relationships. For detailed, paginated relationship data, use the 'get_domain_relationship' tool. Parameters: domain (required): The domain name to analyze (e.g., 'google.com', 'evil-domain.net').

tools.name: get_ip_relationship
tools.description: Name: get_ip_report Description: Get a comprehensive IP address analysis report including geolocation, reputation data, and key relationships like communicating/downloaded files, historical certificates/WHOIS, resolutions, and related URLs/threat actors. This tool automatically fetches summary information for these key relationships. For detailed, paginated relationship data, use the 'get_ip_relationship' tool. Parameters: ip (required): The IP address to analyze (e.g., '8.8.8.8', '192.168.1.1').

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@emeryray2002/virustotal-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: virustotalApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: VirusTotal API Key required to authenticate API calls.
